author: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
description: Amazon has soared more than 1,900 percent since President Bill Clinton's impeachment.
title: Cramer: Don't overreact to Trump crises â€” imagine if you sold Amazon during Clinton's impeachment

author: Richard Wolf
description: Here's a look at the process to remove a president from office. In U.S. history, only Andrew Johnson and Bill Clinton have been impeached (but not convicted), and only Richard Nixon has resigned in disgrace.
title: Impeachment: Donald Trump's worst nightmare?

author: Z. Byron Wolf, CNN
description: "We're in impeachment territory now," declared David Gergen, the presidential counselor who should know a thing or two about the subject; he advised both a Republican (Richard Nixon) and Democrat (Bill Clinton), who dealt with impeachment in their respective second terms.
title: Impeachment guide: It would be nasty and complicated

author: Jon Sharman
description: Donald Trump's personal request that the FBI drop its investigation into disgraced national security adviser Michael Flynn, if true, could see the President's fledgling administration already entering "impeachment territory". That's according to a former adviser to three presidents, two of whom - Richard Nixon and Bill Clinton - faced impeachment proceedings.
title: Donald Trump 'in impeachment territory', says adviser to Nixon, Reagan, and Clinton
